title: Strictly's Stacey Dooley claims she was 'so sh*t' at dancing before winning with beau Kevin Clifton
text:

Stacey Dooley has discussed she was "so sh*t" and "embarrassed and mortified" by her dancing when she first appeared on Strictly Come Dancing .

The TV presenter, 32, who went on to win last years series of the dancing show and to find love with her professional dance partner Kevin Clifton, has lifted the lid on her experience.

Speaking on Angela Scanlon’s Thanks A Million podcast, the red-haired star reflected: "Strictly for me was total escapism. Really thoroughly enjoyed myself. It is hard work, like physically it’s very demanding.

"And I was so sh*t at the start, I was dancing against people like Fay and Ashley who were incredible – I was so embarrassed, I was mortified."

However, the documentary maker did not let this stop her and so she decided to up her training in order to improve.

(Image: UKTV)

"So I thought I have to put in more hours than everyone else to just not look ridiculous. It wasn’t even about looking great, it was about not looking horrendous. So I was dancing maybe sort of 10 or 12 hours a day," explained the star."

When Angela asked if this was Stacey's rehearsal schedule from the start, the glitterball winner added: "No, so the first couple of weeks I was filming Glow Up and didn’t have the time so I was doing sort of 3 hours a day.

"But you have two weeks on the initial dance so they ease you in quite gently then, after that, I had a really horrible week two, I did the cha cha and it was just absolutely… I can’t even bear it, so cringe."

(Image: BBC/Kieron McCarron)

Stacey also touched on her reasons for signing up to the series as she needed "to take a break and do something lighter" away from her "super intense" documentary job that saw her visit war-torn places.

She shared: "Work can be super intense. You know it got to the stage, when we said yes to Strictly, it got to the stage where I’d been to Iraq a couple to times, and it was just really emotionally draining, it was really full on.

"It was a total privilege to do but total hard core. I remember getting out the car and there were so many unexploded IEDS that we could only walk a certain way and we were being chaperoned by the Iraqi forces, the Iraqi army, and it meant that the path that was safe and had been cleared was walking across two bodies, Isis fighters.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC/Kieron McCarron)

"And I just remember as soon as you get out the car you smell death. Unless you’ve been there it’s very difficult to comprehend or describe but I remember at that moment thinking, it’s remarkable that I’m here and I really want to tell these stories but I also need to take a break maybe and do something a little bit lighter."

Last week Stacey's boyfriend Kevin and his 2019 partner Anneka Rice were voted off the show.

After the news broke, Stacey took to social media to praise the pair and gush that her beau is "the most incredible teacher."

You can download Angela Scanlon’s Thanks A Million podcast now on iTunes and Acast.
description: The documentary maker, who won last years series of the dancing show and is now dating her professional partner Kevin Clifton, has opened up on her Strictly experience
